shortdesc.ph: Starts video capture using the camera.
Starts video capture using the camera.
Starts video capture using the camera.
Starts video capture using the camera.

p.codeblock: public abstract int StartCameraCapture(VIDEO_SOURCE_TYPE sourceType, CameraCapturerConfiguration config);

section.p: Call this method to start multiple camera captures simultaneously by specifying sourceType.
Call this method to start multiple camera captures simultaneously by specifying sourceType.
Call this method to start multiple camera captures simultaneously by specifying sourceType.
You can call this method to start multiple camera captures simultaneously by specifying sourceType.
section.note: On iOS, to enable multiple camera captures, you must call and set enabled to before calling this method.
On iOS, to enable multiple camera captures, you must call and set enabled to before calling this method.
On iOS, to enable multiple camera captures, you must call and set enabled to before calling this method.

plentry.pd:
The type of video source. See .
On desktop platforms, up to 4 video streams from camera capture are supported.

Type of video source. See .
iOS devices support up to 2 video streams from camera capture (requires devices with multiple cameras or external camera support).
Android devices support up to 4 video streams from camera capture (requires devices with multiple cameras or external camera support).
Video capture configuration. See . On iOS, this parameter has no effect. Use the config parameter in to configure video capture.

Type of video source. See .
iOS devices support up to 2 video streams from camera capture (requires multi-camera or external camera support).
Android devices support up to 4 video streams from camera capture (requires multi-camera or external camera support).
Desktop supports up to 4 video streams from camera capture.
Video capture configuration. See . On iOS, this parameter has no effect. Use the config parameter in to configure video capture settings.

The type of video source. See .
iOS devices support up to 2 video streams from camera capture (requires devices with multiple cameras or external camera support).
Android devices support up to 4 video streams from camera capture (requires devices with multiple cameras or external camera support).
Desktop supports up to 4 video streams from camera capture.
Video capture configuration. See . On iOS, this parameter has no effect. Use the config parameter in to configure video capture.

section.title: Return Values

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
< 0: The method call fails. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

section.p: When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when fails, the exception is thrown. You need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
